availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The commonwealth of Kentucky to the sheff of Oldham County

We command you that you take the Body of A I Taylor and him safely keep until he shall satisfy us in the Sum of one hundred dollars which we take in our Ballard Circuit Court having recovered against him upon a recognizance filed in said Court as well as the sum of $5,75 which to as in the same court was adjudged to us for our cost in that behalf expended whereof the said Taylor, is Convict as appears to us of record and how you have executed this writ make known to the judge of our said court at the court House in Blandville on the first day of October 1865
